column4: Its hard to tell where the mirrors are when you download Ubuntu, its poorly done
It's designed that way to make it less confusing for you...
archive.<country_code>.ubuntu.com performs some magic to redirect you to your fastest local mirror...
Unfortunately the open source alternatives aren't really ready yet, so Adobe is still the only real choice for now.
Okay,.. Thanks
He didn't, that's just the main reason for Flash these days  :P
haha i know.. thats funny
There's no way anyone would care about getting ads working  :)
look in /usr/lib/xscreensaver/ for the screensaver and delete the file... every time the package updates, the screensaver will come back though.
Thanks... I'll try it
sudo chown -R eboyjr /home/<you>
Thanks... would I also chmod with 664?
no need.
Because now I have to call sudo ls -l to acces the permissions information... It says permission denied
It only works when I call sudo
yes, because your user doesn't own those files... my command will have you own it.
After that command, it still doesnt work
what is the error?
Just of bunch of: ls: cannot access /var/www/web: Permission denied
Heh, you look busy :)
add your user to /etc/group under 'www-data' and log out and back in.
I dont have a www-date group
www-data ... look harder, it's a default group.
